title: Japanese Agedashi Tofu Recipe
description: This quick and easy Japanese fried tofu recipe is a great appetizer. Crispy fried cubes of tofu are served with a tasty sauce and chopped green onion.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Japanese Agedashi Tofu 4.4 (5) 4 Reviews 3 Photos This quick and easy Japanese fried tofu recipe is a great appetizer. Crispy fried cubes of tofu are served with a tasty sauce and chopped green onion. Submitted by ChefJackie Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 3 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (10.5 ounce) package firm silken tofu 2 cups water 2 tablespoons light soy sauce 2 tablespoons mirin 1 teaspoon dashi granules ¼ cup all-purpose flour, or as needed vegetable oil for frying 2 green onions, chopped Directions Place the block of tofu between sheets of paper towels. Set a plate on top; add a 3- to 5-pound weight to the plate. Press tofu for 15 minutes; drain and discard the accumulated liquid. Meanwhile, combine water, soy sauce, mirin, and dashi in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and set aside. Remove weight, plate, and paper towels. Cut tofu into 3/4-inch cubes. Place flour in a bowl and lightly coat tofu with flour. Heat oil in a heavy pot and fry tofu until golden-brown, 4 to 6 minutes. Fry in batches if necessary so as not to overcrowd the pot. Place fried tofu in a serving dish and pour sauce on top. Sprinkle with green onions. AllrecipesPhoto Editor's Note: We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used. Add Your Photo Photos of Japanese Agedashi Tofu 01 of 03 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 02 of 03 Photo by  Allison Currie 03/09/2019 Great flavor, will make again, BUT I will not pour sauce over the tofu, it gets soggy. It would be better to dip as I go. 03 of 03 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 04/04/2018 1 You’ll Also Love Easy Chicken Yakitori 9 Ratings Chinese Scallion Pancakes 29 Ratings Sweet Potato Tempura 5 Ratings Marvel's Beef and Scallion Rolls (Negimaki) Green Beans with Tofu and Tahini Dressing Keto Beef Egg Roll Slaw 147 Ratings Korean Boiled Bean Sprouts Salad 1 Rating Miso Soup with Shiitake Mushrooms 35 Ratings Tofu Hiyayakko 23 Ratings Authentic Sweet and Sour Pork 2 Ratings Chef John's Shrimp Toast 29 Ratings Air-Fried Korean Chicken Wings 31 Ratings Beef Bulgogi with Dipping Sauce 2 Ratings Air Fryer Beef Wontons 3 Ratings Michelle's Chicken Yakitori 1 Rating Green Onion Pancake 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: ChefJackie
instructions: Place the block of tofu between sheets of paper towels. Set a plate on top; add a 3- to 5-pound weight to the plate. Press tofu for 15 minutes; drain and discard the accumulated liquid.;Meanwhile, combine water, soy sauce, mirin, and dashi in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and set aside.;Remove weight, plate, and paper towels. Cut tofu into 3/4-inch cubes. Place flour in a bowl and lightly coat tofu with flour.;Heat oil in a heavy pot and fry tofu until golden-brown, 4 to 6 minutes. Fry in batches if necessary so as not to overcrowd the pot. Place fried tofu in a serving dish and pour sauce on top. Sprinkle with green onions. AllrecipesPhoto
